title: PhotoGallery viewer fixed 85% viewport size with proportional image contain

requirements.summary: Make the PhotoGallery dialog container a constant 85% of the viewport on all devices, independent of image dimensions, with stable internal layout/overflow.
acceptanceCriteria: When opening the Photo Gallery, the dialog content renders at 85% of the viewport width and 85% of the viewport height on both mobile and desktop.
Viewer size remains constant while navigating between images of different aspect ratios/resolutions (no layout jumps tied to image dimensions).
No part of the viewer (including header/footer) is pushed off-screen due to image dimensions; internal scrolling/overflow is controlled within the viewer as needed.

file_operations.description: Update the shadcn-ui DialogContent sizing from the current vw/vh values to a fixed w-[85vw] and h-[85vh] (and keep max-w-none), ensuring the viewer container never resizes based on the displayed image. Ensure the internal flex layout cannot overflow (e.g., use min-h-0 on the flex content area so header/footer remain visible and overflow is contained within the viewer). Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.

requirements.summary: Ensure gallery images always fit proportionally within the fixed viewer area (contain), with no cropping or overflow across aspect ratios and resolutions.
acceptanceCriteria: Very wide (panorama) and very tall (portrait) images remain fully visible within the viewer area.
Images maintain aspect ratio and are displayed using a contain-style fit (no stretching).
Images never extend beyond the viewer bounds on any screen size; no horizontal scrolling is required to see the full image.

file_operations.description: Adjust the carousel slide/image layout so each slide provides a stable bounded box for the image (e.g., ensure CarouselItem and its inner wrapper fill available height/width and are overflow-hidden). Keep the in proportional contain mode (object-contain) with max-w/max-h constraints so it never overflows and never crops, regardless of aspect ratio. Verify the component's usage instructions before implementing.
